contest-event.event-date: Sept. 25, 1926 D National Championship of Great Britain (Crystal Palace) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship An Epic Symphony Crystal Palace (Concert Hall), Crystal Palace Park, Sydenham, County of London, England, UK Prizes: 1st: 100 Pounds plus the 1000 Guinea Trophy 2nd: 50 Pounds plus the Daily Telegraph Challenge Cup 3rd: 30 Pounds 4th: 20 Pounds 5th: 10 Pounds The Test Piece was recorded on three 12" sides in a relay from CP and issued shortly after on the Columbia label. The fourth side was the Hallelujah Chorus (Handel). The recording quality is excellent and is one of several made at various events during that year.
